718032f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Thompson Street
718032f-a.text:
Canal Street, west from the southern end of Thompson Street, prior
to the digling of the Independent (municipal) Subway and the south-
bound extension of Sixth Avenue. The first step taken will be the
demolition of all the buildings on the north side of Canal Street
from Thompson to Sullivan Streets.
1926.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
718032f-a.folder: Canal Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

718031f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Thompson Street
718031f-a.text:
(1)
Canal Street, north side, west from Thompson Street and Sixth Avenue
Extension. All the buildings from Thompson to Sullivan Streets have
been demolished, and the west side of Sullivan Street, from Canal
to Grand Streets, will form the west side of this part of Sixth
Avenue. The eight-story Peter Frasse \& Company building stands at
the N.W. corner of Canal and Sullivan Streets. The ten-story
Powell Chocolate factory, on the N.E. corner, has just been demolished.
December 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same at a later date and showing a view northward on the new
Sixth Ave. Extension. Un the left appears a portion of Varick Street.
718031f-a.folder: Canal Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

718031f-b.text:
(1)

724397f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Canal Street
724397f-a.text:
St. Alphonsus (Roman Catholic) Church and Rectory, 310-314 and 308
West Broadway (formerly 228 and 234 South Fifth Avenue), west side,
between Canal and Grand Streets. The Hall (former school) is next
door (off the picture at the right) at No. 316-328 Yest Broadway.
This church was organized in 1847; but the present buildings were
erected since, though probably not long after 1870, when South
Fifth Avenue Was created by widening Laurens Street from Canal
to Amity Streets (West 3rd Street), and cutting it through the
block to Washington Square.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724397f-a.folder: West Broadway & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718024f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - West Broadway
718024f-a.text:
370-372 Canal Street, south side, east of West Broadway.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 297.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

718025f-a.text:

May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

723505f-a.title: Manhattan: Thompson Street - Canal Street
723505f-a.text:

718028f.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - West Broadway
718028f.text:
Canal Street (left) south side, east from West Broadway.
June 11, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

718028f.folder: Canal Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

718027f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - West Broadway
718027f-b.text:
No. 1.
Canal St., south side, east from Aest Broadway (right, not shown),
to Broadway (left) and across Church St., showing a clearance at the
S. W. corner of the latter point, over which towers the upper portion
of No. 401 Broadway.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
No. 2.
A view in the opposite direction (westward), showing the new
Post Office site under preparation on the west side of Church St.
The Sixth Avenue elevated line appears at the right running at
this point on West Sroadway. To the extreme 1eft, one sees a
portion of the Telephone Co. Bldg.
March 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718027f-b.folder: Canal Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724396f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Canal Street
724396f-b.text:
West Broadway (Sixth Ave. Elevated line thereon), north from
Canal Street, showing on the west side of the former, St. Alphonsus
Roman Catholic Church.
No. 2 includes the 4 story structure (No. 375 Canal Street and
No. 301 Nest Broadway), at the N.E. corner.
May 2, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718029f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - West Broadway
718029f-b.text:
Canal Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E.
corner of West Broadway as photographed from the S.W. corner.
A similar view as this was prohibited previously,
as the old Sixth Avenue ''El'' which ran on West Broadway
obstructed the view. Recently this was raged in its entirety.
View 1: March 19. 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

724394f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Canal Street
724394f-a.text:
West Broadway, west side, south from and across
Canal Street. Irg the center and on a diagonal runs
the Sixth Avenue Extsnsion. This forms the far side of
the triangular plot utilized as a gasoline station.
July 25, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
724394f-a.folder: West Broadway & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

724395f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Canal Street
724395f-a.text:
West Broadway, north from and across Canal Street,
showing the thoroughfare subsequent to demolition of the
Sixth Avenue ''El.''
On the west side of same, between Canal and
Broome Street's is St. Alphonsus R. C. Church, Rectory
and Hall. This area is shown solely in View 2.
View 1: March 19, 1939
View 2: July 12, 1939
P. L. Sparr
NO REPRODUCTIOIS
724395f-a.folder: West Broadway & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

724399f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Canal Street
724399f-b.text:
West Broadway, north from a point between Canal
and Grand Street's and across the latter.
View 1 emphasizes the walled yard of the Railway
Express Agency on the east side of this thorough-fare.
The not shown St. Alphonsus Church (left) faces this.
Views 2 and 3 are from a vantage point closer to
Grand Street. Note in the earlier view the iron standards
that formerly supported the old Sixth Avenue ''E1.''
In the background,beyond Washington Scuare appears
the apartment structure, No. 1 Fifth Avenue and the
Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. tower.
Views 1, 2: May 19, 1939
View 3: March 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO RCPROLUUCTIONS
724399f-b.folder: West Broadway & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718030f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Thompson Street
718030f-b.text:
(1)
Canal Street, north side, from Thompson Street to West Broadway
(formerly South Fifth Avenue), seen from the eastern end of
Laight Street.
September 24, 1927.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a year later, seen from York Street at West Broadway,
across the site of the buildings between york and Canal Streets
Canal Street is being supported on stilts which the constructio
of the subway goes on underneath; the view at the left is
praotically north along the future east side of Sixth Avenue.
Krist's Bakery, the light house with the dormer window, is No.
387 Canal Street. In the background of both these views aay
be seen the steeple of St. Alphonsus' Roman Catholic Church.
October 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 2, as seen from Sixth Ave. Extension at West
Broadway. Elevated shown is the Sixth Ave. line.
718030f-b.folder: Canal Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

718033f-a.text:

391-387 Canal Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Thompson

October 21, 1936.

()

718034f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Thompson Street
718034f-a.text:
Former home of the People's Bank, 395 Canal Street at the N.E. c
of Thompson Street, and the gap adjoining, where No. 391 stood
The timbers buttress the east wall of No. 395 and the west wall
389 against each other.
March 19, 1932.

723506f-a.title: Manhattan: Thompson Street - Canal Street
723506f-a.text:
(1)
4-10 Thompson Street, adjoining and ncrth of the N.E. corner of
Canal Street. Nos. 8-10 is the St. Alphonsus R.C. Church, with the
Parochial School (Nos. 4-6) adjoining. This view is as seen from the new
Sixth Ave. Extension and during its construction period.
October 19, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, during demoliton period.
September 9, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, slightly more extensive; at a later date. as seen from the
S. W. corner of Laight at Varick St's.
June 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
